Home » News » Wanted mastermind of Zaki Biam massacre being sponsored — Ortom Wanted mastermind of Zaki Biam massacre being sponsored — Ortom On 2:58 am In News by Nwafor Polycarp Comments 
By Peter Duru 
MAKURDI—governor Samuel Ortom of Benue State weekend claimed some individuals were sponsoring the activities of the wanted militant leader, Terwase Agwaza, alias ‘Gana’ whom he fingered in the recent Zaki Biam massacre and other violent crimes in parts of the state. 
Speaking in Makurdi, Governor Ortom said the wanted militant would eventually be arrested to face prosecution. 
According to him: “If you talk about the criminality of Gana, who has been killing people all over, we have declared him wanted and even placed a reward on him. He has gone into hiding and we are appealing to people to avail us of information. I am in touch with the Inspector General of Police, the Chief of Army Staff, the Commandant of Civil Defence, the DSS Director General and security men and equipment have been provided for Benue State. Gov Samuel Ortom 
“We are going to apprehend him. We are on top of the situation. The security agents in Benue State have done very well. We are proactive. 
”I can assure you that this renewed spate of attacks are not from herdsmen, but from Gana who is killing people and because he is being sponsored by some people. We are going after him. 
”The police, NSCDC, Army and the DSS are working with me because we believe in the rule of law and due process. I don’t need to take laws into my hands when the conventional security apparatus of the state are there. I am in touch with the President. We are all working together to ensure we achieve this.” 
When asked to mention the names of the alleged sponsors of the militant leader, the governor said, “No, it is not every security matter that you say or discuss in public. Some are classified and I won’t say that for now.” Nwafor Polycarp
